intro: Montanoa schottii, commonly known as the Mexican mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces trumpet-shaped, violet to blue flowers that bloom in the morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Montanoa schottii is often found in forest understories and along stream banks in its native habitat.
